dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but listen to this. Five hundred thousand new employees? In one year? That's, like, completely insane.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier in the meeting, chief financial officer Brian T. Olsavsky said Amazon hired 500,000 new employees in 2020, bringing its total to more than 1.3 million globally.

dialogue_turns.text: Insane, or just, uh, unprecedented growth? I mean, they had record profits, clearly they needed the staff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Insane, or just, uh, unprecedented growth? I mean, they had record profits, clearly they needed the staff.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Needed? Or just, like, pure unchecked market dominance? They're literally facing an antitrust lawsuit right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Needed? Or just, like, pure unchecked market dominance? They're literally facing an antitrust lawsuit right now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bezos also answered concerns about the companys impact on competition and regulatory scrutiny, a day after the District of Columbia filed an antitrust lawsuit against Amazon, believed to be the first against the company by a U.S. government agency.

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but Bezos said they face competition everywhere. And, um, he's moving on to philanthropy. Longevity! Curing cancer!

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We face intense competition from well-established companies everywhere we do business, in every industry, he said. [The article does not mention Bezos's philanthropic plans for longevity or curing cancer.]

dialogue_turns.text: Philanthropy? Or just, like, a convenient exit strategy from all the civil rights allegations? Pay disparity? Union busting?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Significant? Or just a, uh, PR move while they're talking about "Beyond Earth" and sending rockets into space? Interstellar logistics, seriously?

dialogue_turns.text: That proposal was narrowly defeated. And they're focused on, like, free internet for remote communities with Project Aether. That's, uh, a good thing.

dialogue_turns.text: Jassy's taking over. Bezos called him a visionary. Someone who makes the impossible inevitable. Amazon won't become complacent.
